Reviews.Title: Superb TV for a great price
Reviews.Author: Jeremy
Reviews.Content: We recently purchased this television from a different store but were impressed as soon as we turned it on.  We had received a 24" Vizio LCD for Christmas, but its quality was severely lacking - the picture went dark very quickly if you viewed the screen off-center, even about 10-20 degrees off axis - to the point that having the television on top of a chest of drawers caused it to be too high to watch TV with any decent quality.  We returned that one and bought the SV320XVT and were blown away by comparison.Pros: The 1080p quality at 120Hz makes digital television channels look great.  Device buttons are easily accessible for changing inputs instead of pressing a single "Source" or "Input" button multiple times to get to the input you want.  There are three HDMI inputs, which is great for a cable/satellite tuner, Blu-Ray player, and another source (we use it for the Canon 7D's video output).  The viewing angle is excellent, especially for an LCD.  We were able to get a consistent view at about 120-140 degrees off-axis.  Different video modes are available for different types of viewing (Basketball, Golf, Baseball, Movies, Normal, etc.).  Sound quality out-of-the-box is excellent, though a surround sound system could be hooked up with either RCA, HDMI, or TOSlink.Cons: 120Hz can still make some live-acted shows and movies look computer animated, but that happens with any TV that has this feature.  This TV does not have a 10/100 network port, which I've only seen on a few televisions at this point, but it would be nice to have it for web streaming.  There is an RGB input, however, so we can still hook it up to a computer.  I'd also like if the TV had an alarm clock on it, but that's a very minor issue.  Also, having a jog dial on the bottom right side of the panel makes for an awkward way of controlling power, volume, and channel control; I'd rather have actual buttons for each.  It took trial and error to figure out that adjusting the volume from the side did not require me to push the button inward to confirm the change, as that just turned off the TV.

Reviews.Title: Good Solid TV
Reviews.Author: SD PHOTOG "SD PHOTOG"
Reviews.Content: "We were looking for a Bedroom TV that didn't dominate the whole space so we were excited to see the "slim-ness" of the unit and the small bezel around the LCD. The unit is nice and light so it can be easily transferred and wall mounted.The picture quality is great, it's quality exceeds our three year old Phillips LCD and equals the PQ of our two month old 52" Sony Bravia. HD signals from BLU-RAY and TiVo HD (w/ HD CableCARD) look wonderful with rich colors and sharp picture. The Smooth Motion (120Hz) does create the "Soap Opera Effect", but it can be turned off in the setup men. There are plenty of video tweaks in the menus just like the other Major Brands.The sound quality was really good. Obviously nothing that gets you to 5.1 home theater level but has plenty of options for audio mode adjustments.The build quality is wonderful, solid, slim, design, down to the box it came in. The remote is good, looks pretty, the channel up/down Volume up/down button light up, which is a nice touch. The inputs in the back are configured well, with nice color separation for visual cues.The only issues that prevented the TV from getting a Solid 5 is the Menu system and remote's button layout.The setup menu was difficult to navigate, with some important settings buried deep in submenus upon submenus.The input menu does not give the option to "skip" or "not display" inputs that aren't in use. This is an issue when you only have two devices connected to the TV but you have click through 8 inputs to get to the device you want.This is a solid TV and our first VIZIO product. Would recommend it to anyone."

Reviews.Title: An Amazing TV At An Even More Amazing PrIce!!
Reviews.Author: K. Benson "Benny90"
Reviews.Content: I have owned many LCD TV's over the years. From Sharp to Sony and from Magnavox and Toshiba. My most recent was a beautiful 24" LED TV and a 46" Sharp Aquous LCD TV. I have also owned over 5 32" HDTV's, the most recent being a Sony KDL-32S5100 and before that a 40" KDL-40S4100. While I was entirely happy with the excellent quality of the S4100 the S5100 was HUGELY disappointing. The S4100 had some higher end specs with a 10-bit panel and a very nice casing. As the SonyKDL-32S5100 nearly directly competes with the Vizio SV320XVT I will compare the two. As a cost saving initive by Sony the S5100 dropped all the quality parts. It has a lesser 8-but panel and the casing overall feels cheap and is a much lesser quality than I had come to expect from Sony, especially in this price range. The Vizio however screams of quality.The looks of this set is absolutely beautiful. You can truely tell that Vizio took their top of the line parts and put them all into this awesome package.  The casing of the set is stunning. It has a beautiful gloss black surrounding the screen with the speakers, which are the best I have heard from a set this size, sit at the bottom. A very cool little feature is the light up VIzio branding under the screen. It glows a pleasent orange when the set is off and white when it is on. Even the remote is high quality. It is by far the nicest remote to come with any TV I have ever owned. It is super thin and light has a gloss black and chrome case and also has universal remote capability. I have it controlling a Samsung Blu-Ray player, which by the way looks simply awesome on this set. Smother awesome thing about the set is that it is only 2.2 inches thick! This leaves a bunch of extra space on my table for anything else that I want and would be excellent for wall mounting.Unlike other 1080P sets that I have had SD content looks very good, even coming in straight from a wall jack. The HD 1080P processing on this set is in a league of it's own, image truely pop from the screen, unlike the Sony which was only just ok. Some people do not like 120Hz sets as they can sometimes have weird effects on what you are watching. I can proudly say that that is not the case here. Another huge plus are the speakers. On my Sony I had to get a separate sound bar to have the sound quality that I wanted. However, no sound bar is needed for this set. I don't get the low end bass that I got with it but everything else, mids and highs sound perfect.If you can't tell, I am absolutely in love with this TV and recommend it to anyone looking for a 32" HDTV. It is an amazing TV at an amazing price. Vizio has a new long term customer in me!!

Reviews.Title: Awesome t.v.
Reviews.Author: gary
Reviews.Content: I havent really made a review before but i thought i would being i could not find any reviews on this t.v. before buying it. This is my fourth lcd t.v. Other brands i own are philips 42 inch 1080p, mavnavox 32 inch 1080i and a samsung 24 inch 1080p. I bought this t.v. to replace my 24 inch samsung i was using as a gaming/computer work bench monitor and i have to say i am not sorry for making the purchase. It exceeds the picture quality of my samsung 1080p. I upgraded my video card in my pc to include an hdmi output in which transfers both video and sound to the t.v. so i therefore eliminate the audio cable if i were for use the rgb pc input. The t.v. has a rca audio out for easy connection to a stereo system or simply buy a rca to 3.5 heaphone jack to connect to pc speakers in which is my setup. The graphics through my xbox 360 is awesome in game mode. Video from my pc is pretty good i am still messing with the settings which may be my video card or the t.v.'s setting. Vizio has definitely won me over with this one.

Reviews.Title: First LCD
Reviews.Author: Detroit John
Reviews.Content: Our old Sony finally quit on a weekend and we needed a replacement right away.  I usually shop things to death but in this case time did not allow that luxury.  I had intended to buy a Samsung but decided to take a chance on this unit because of price, availability and advise from a knowledgeable family member.  I have not been disappointed in any way with my choice.  Set up was quick and easy although the manual could use some work on some of the features.  The picture and the sound both off the dish and the antenna is perfect and compares to much more expensive units I have watched.  I really like the wide viewing angle and how sharp and viewable the picture is at extreme angles.  The remote buttons are a little small and crowded and the remote could use back lit buttons never the less it gives you complete control over the televisions features.  As of yet I have not seen a perfect flat screen TV but for the price this one makes a good run at it.

Reviews.Title: Intermittent audio failure
Reviews.Author: acls
Reviews.Content: My set had a complete failure of audio on some channels and some DVRs but intermittently. We isolated the problem to the TV set (not the HDMI cable or set-top/DVR box). After troubleshooting, Vizio technical said the problem was particular to my TV set and offered to fix it. But, since I was in the 30 day purchase period, I returned the set. I re-ordered the same model and will let you know how it works.The audio problem was unusual because the failure on a given channel seemed to depend on the way you accessed the channel. I mean if I used the channel+ button to get to channel 840, for example, there was absolutely no audio. If I continued to use channel+ to go up a few channels and then used channel- to get back to channel 840, I often had full audio. The DVR audio failure was intermittent, also. I could try to play a DVR and get no audio but if I changed the channel that I was tuned to and went back to play the DVR sometimes I got audio. I wish they included schematics with the set.When I did have audio, the quality was fine.The sharpness of the picture was excellent.

Reviews.Title: VERRRY NICE!!!
Reviews.Author: Old Jeezy
Reviews.Content: Only had this television for a couple days but... It's AWESOME. Perfect size for a bed, guest, or dorm room. Looks great right out of the box, w/out any tweaking. Blu-Ray looks fantastic. It's super thin and sounds pretty good too. Recommend using HMDI cables. 120hz and 1080P make a real difference. This is a a great set for a great price. If you get one, I hope you enjoy it as much as we have so far.

Reviews.Title: VIZIO 32-Inch Class XVT!
Reviews.Author: lpb27
Reviews.Content: I got this t.v. expecting it to be just a regular HD TV, but this television has surpassed my own expectations. Equipped with smooth motion technology (120hz) and 1080p resolution this t.v. is perfect for your bedroom. The picture is amazing (especially for blu-rays and video games) and the stock surround sound quality will surprise you. I recommend this television for anyone looking for a t.v. for their bedroom.

Reviews.Title: Attractive IPS panel for a good price
Reviews.Author: E. Kelly
Reviews.Content: Okay, so I spent about three weeks scouring Amazon for good, technical reviews on 32-inch TV's. I recently canceled my cable TV, so I began using my computer to watch things and play some Xbox occasionally; my 27-inch monitor wasn't really cutting it anymore.I decided that a 32-inch was just enough of an upgrade to make it easier on the eyes. I wasn't really looking for anything top-tier, but I was definitely hoping for slightly better quality. My Samsung P2770HD was versatile, but the vertical viewing angles and light bleed were pretty big issues.Vizio has stepped up its game lately, so I figured I'd give them my money and see how it went. Amazon has a good return policy, after all.I couldn't be happier.The first thing I did after getting this display and turning it on was getting up close and personal and taking a look at the pixels. Mine arrived with an IPS panel, which is easy to tell by looking at the geometry of the pixels. A quick Google image search will show you what I mean.So, I was immediately satisfied. I knew this would be a lot better, but I wasn't expecting everything that came my way.- The contrast is pretty incredible. I actually had to turn it down to 30 / 100 to make it usable as a computer monitor.- The backlight is really, really strong. Keep in mind this does NOT mean "brightness." This is the actual power of the light that lights the screen. I keep this at about 80-85 depending upon the media.- Viewing angles are pretty incredible. Vertically: awesome. Horizontally: awesome.- Resolution is obviously 1920x1080. Not bad if you're sitting 3-4 feet away from it as a computer and 8-10 for movies / games. It could be sharper, of course, but I'm not complaining. You just have to get used to the new DPI and make some sacrifices unless you have $2,000 for a professional monitor.- Picture adjustments within the menu are pretty in-depth, and contrary to what I read in reviews here, the menu system isn't confusing at all.- Build quality is good and it's a really thin TV. I'll be mounting it on the wall behind my desk soon to save some space. I imagine it'll be pretty easy since this isn't a bulky TV.- Sound could be better, but who cares? It's good enough and I have external speakers anyway, as this is mostly a computer monitor.- 120hz is nice, but keep in mind that Mac OS X does not recognize that. At least, not that I've been able to see.Other than all of that, I have yet to stumble across any negatives. It takes quite a bit of time to calibrate and get it to more "neutral" settings for everyday use, but once you're done with that, you're good to go.Assuming all of this model are manufactured as IPS displays, then I highly recommend this purchase. Just be 100% sure that it's IPS when it shows up at your door, or else send it back. Get your money's worth.Kudos to Vizio for a good first impression.

Reviews.Title: Great TV Buy
Reviews.Author: N. Kostallas
Reviews.Content: Biggest piece of s*** ive ever wasted my money on. Half the screen blew out in the middle of a monday night football game. never buying from vizio again their customer service sucks. they did not honor their warranty and the seller i bought it from did not honor the warranty.

Reviews.Title: Lasted only 2 months
Reviews.Author: Macaluso
Reviews.Content: I purchased mine in December and it permanenetly shut down after 2 months. Customer support (877-698-4946) is very eager to help, but were unable to do anything except arrange to have it brought in for repair.

Reviews.Title: Great 32" HDTV but needs tweaking for best results
Reviews.Author: G. Gordon "Gordy"
Reviews.Content: I give it 41/2 stars and would have given the set 5 stars across the board, but feel that the sound could be a bit better and was unhappy that the audio out is not amplified so I could just add some external speakers. The picture is great to fantastic and I found some good settings posted on line to get a really good and realistic picture. For sound I also found online that the factory settings for the equalizer are set too high and tuned them down to get a very acceptable sound but not as good as I would prefer, still has a laptop sound quality too it, at least to me. So again, if only I could attach external speakers to the set directly and have the TV sound control control them. Hate to, but I may have to go to an amp for externals. I would highly recommend this TV and was able to get a $150 off during the 4 hour gold box special from Amazon along with free shipping, so yes I got a very very good TV for under $400.

Reviews.Title: Best bang for your buck. Split-screen too!
Reviews.Author: PakoPako
Reviews.Content: First off, let me say that I love having split-screen. Absolutely cannot live without it. I had it on an old ViewSonic, and when that went out, I was worried since very few models today support split-screen. Samsung and SONY have PnP/PoP/split-screen with PC inputs, but not with HDMI or component or composite. I don't know why -- who doesn't think it's awesome to watch the weather report (TV) and play Rock Band (Xbox) at the same time? Or split their TV so one half of the room can use the PS3 (HDMI) while the other half is on the Wii (YPbPr)? I have a DVR with its own tuner so I can even watch two shows side-by-side. VIZIO is one of if not THE last brand to keep Picture-in-Picture, Picture-outside-Picture, or Split-Screen viewing.Onto the review.Isn't technology great? My last LCD TV was about the same size, but weighed almost FOUR times as much. This Vizio SV320XVT is so incredibly light, I can lift it with one arm! The knob is a great space-saving innovation and the universal remote has a (half) clear and easy-to-read layout. The viewing area is 1-for-1, pixel perfect if you nitpick about that sort of thing. (I do; my old LCD had 5% overscan so stuff like TV logos or team scores in the lower corners of the screen are cut off.) It's also got more inputs than you can imagine, from VGA/RGB to even S-Video! On top of that, you can have up to 10 customizable color/brightness pre-sets (great for all the inputs you're putting through).The colors are amazing, though not as great as my friend's Panasonic 40" Viera LCD. But he paid almost three times as much, so he deserves that. The built-in speakers are serviceable, but if you have external ones (via RCA stereo or SPDIF) then I'd suggest using those. If this is going to be your bedroom cozy-TV, you can probably live with the standard speakers, but the internal mixer settings are pretty bad if you go beyond "flat".The worst end of this deal is the Smooth Motion. It bumps up the screen frequency to 120 Hz to show realistic movement. It actually works like a charm and even 80's episodes of Law & Order look like they were happening in front of your eyes. However, human eyes aren't really used to 120 Hz viewing and prolonged exposure (in my case, 1 minute, 47 seconds) can cause dizziness or nausea.The remote I said was pretty clear, and that's half true. The split-screen viewing buttons and universal switches are difficult to see and reach, but the channels and menu buttons are nice and big. (Plus the volume and channel surf buttons light up when pressed.)After half a year of usage, there is a bit of an EMF buzz from the power adapter built inside, but that's to be expected from most electronics these days. For anyone who hands their TVs flush against their walls, you'll need those "elbow" plugs because this thin TV doesn't have enough depth to offer downward-facing inputs.Bottom-line: If you want a great-performing 32" TV for an affordable price, you don't have to look anywhere else. It's even light with legacy inputs and split-screen. Just be sure to lower all the brightness settings first.

Reviews.Title: Excellent 32" flat screen LCD TV
Reviews.Author: Jordan M. Braunstein
Reviews.Content: I was initially interested in this television via a DELL Home discount, but decided to order through Amazon, at only a marginally higher price.  I was looking for something to replace an aging 27" CRT.I'm what you might consider an informed TV consumer; I know a few things about panel display differences, refresh rates, response time, signal-sourcing, pull-down methods etc.  After some research, I decided that this Vizio was a good buy, and I'm happy to report it's met my expectations.The TV is very slim, light and low-profile with a handsome stand but would be a good candidate for wall mounting.  As any HDTV owner knows, picture quality depends on several factors in addition to the quality of the television itself; Fortunately, HD signals look wonderful and while there are enough advanced picture options to tweak to your hearts content, the preset picture "modes" do a fine job of representing a range of different looks and tones for whatever is being displayed (ex. movie mode provides a warm color filter that replicates the look of film rather well, while "game" is appropriately bright and punchy).  The panel is an IPS display, which is important in that the richness of the color and picture is maintained without distortion or wash-out at wide angles of view.  Non-HD sourced video will look crappy at any angle, but that's par for the course.The 120hz true-motion feature is great for smoothing out fast action and decreasing judder while watching sports or other media shot on video.  Be aware that it will artificially add that "shot on video" effect to film and other media recorded at 24fps for which this is not intended, ruining the viewing experience in my opinion.  Good thing its easy to turn on/off from the menu.With 4 HDMI ports and a USB port for flash drives, its ready for multiple inputs and can easily serve as a nice computer monitor too (haven't tried that myself).One important thing about the sound.  Volume shouldn't be an issue in any moderately sized room.  However, turn the simulated surround sound ON (its off by default).  The difference is night and day.  You will think this TV's speakers are garbage until you turn that setting on, at which point the sound quality instantly becomes great for integrated speakers on a flat-panel.  If you're connecting your own speakers or home-theater system, this is a moot point.If you buy this TV, you won't be disappointed as long as you know what to expect.  My only personal quibble is that it's a little too small for the room it's placed in, but that's my fault, not the TVs.  Bear in mind, 32" is not a big screen!  If you're going to be sitting more than 5 ft. away from the screen, I'd recommend a 37"-42" screen at a minimum for the best experience.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy this product
Reviews.Author: Paul J Gscheidle
Reviews.Content: After just a year and a half, this TV developed the irritating habit of turning itself off for no apparent reason.  I contacted Customer Service who told me that, in order to re-start it, I must unplug the set from the power source, depress the on/ off button for 30 seconds,  re-connect the power and turn the set back on.  It sometimes takes three or more attempts before the tv works again.  When it does come back, the television may stay on for anywhere between five minutes and five hours before it shuts itself off again.Because I am outside the one year warranty, there's nothing else Vizio will do.  I was directed to the toll-free telephone numbers of two "partner repair services" whom I declined to contact, because I don't want to go through the hassle of sending the TV off somewhere.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, so-so sound quality
Reviews.Author: Curt Mader "Geekazoid"
Reviews.Content: The picture on this tv is incredible - great color/clarity/sharpness. My one beef with this tv is that the sound quality is not very good. I tried to make adjustments using the on-screen settings but nothing really helped...

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Rick Griffin
Reviews.Content: Easy set-up great picture good price. I've been waiting for pricing to be reasonable for lcd hdtv and you couldn't ask for anything more with this purchase. Vizio is one of the best televisions out there.

Reviews.Title: Highly versatile, works well with iPods
Reviews.Author: Geordie Lad
Reviews.Content: The picture is excellent and the sound and remote control are mediocre as others have commented.  What has impressed me is the versatility of the TV.  For those interested it does support PAL input, at least through regular AV inputs, so if you have a PAL VHS player it will allow you to watch those tapes.  It is multi-voltage (110/240, 50/60Hz) so while it only has NTSC/ATSC tuners it can be used in other countries with existing AV equipment.  The USB port while of limited use (only seems to work with some flashdrives and only for some media types) does provide power.  So, if you have an iPod or Zune with an AV dock/cable you can play AV to the TV AND charge the player via the USB port.

Reviews.Title: my sv320xvt
Reviews.Author: DJ
Reviews.Content: this tv is the best one i have ever bought i got it on tuesday at costco and i am so delighted i bought it

Reviews.Title: Didn't last 6 months.
Reviews.Author: Louise Logar
Reviews.Content: Purchased the set in January 2010, and it's power supply crapped out 5 months later. VIZIO will repair in-home, but the earliest appointment I could get was a week from the day I called.  I should have done my research FIRST before buying.  Numerous reports of shoddy quality, picture/color problems, power supply problems and less-than-stellar support/service.  Tried to save a few pennies, and now I'm stuck with a $550.00 lemon.

Reviews.Title: great tv for a good price!
Reviews.Author: dopedsicko
Reviews.Content: very happy with this purchase. if your looking for a 32inch lcd full hd 1080p and with more than 60hz under 4 bills look no further.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV Horrible speakers that were blown
Reviews.Author: Duhkgeorge "Bashfull user"
Reviews.Content: I'll keep this brief.  The color is beautiful.  You have the ability to hook it up to your computer if you want, which is what I've done temporarily.I've given this a bad review due to blown speakers.  The quality of the sound that does come out is rather poor, but when you hit the bass sounds it rattles like the speakers have been blown and it did this right out of the box.  EXTREMELY annoying.  For such an expensive item I expect it, to you know, work.The logo on the face lights up.  Annoying.The finish is a gloss black which I personally hate.  I AM happy to say that the screen is more a matte finish as opposed to gloss so it's not going to reflect every single ray of sunshine.Lightweight for such a large screen and slim.  If the sound weren't shot out of the box I'd have given a much higher rating although I generally wait a while for more complete reviews.UPDATE 3.09.11I returned it to amazon (I love you amazon) and tried again.  The sound in my old apartment still wasn't that great and certain base sounds still caused a slight blown speaker sound but it was MUCH better.  In my new apartment the sound is great and I'm playing it at a lower volume (I'm not sure why this is the case as my other apartment was smaller.  I moved within two weeks of the first purchase).Overall I'm much happier with the product and no longer feel the need for external speakers.Of note for those who plan to mount it to a wall:  The outputs are somewhat in the way of the brackets and you'll either need connections with 90 degree turns or you'll be scrunching your cords a bit because the output is right where the bracket bar hits.Due to everything and the new monitor I'm upping my current review to three stars.  Hopefully this has some good life to it.  The picture is incredible.  the sound isn't that great, but is working better at lower volume (over 50 seems to be where the issues are.  I believe range is 0-100? for sound)***UPDATE*** 5/19/11No further issues.

Reviews.Title: Vizio 32" XVT LED 1080p 120Hz HDTV
Reviews.Author: Alan J. Leder "tribal tracer"
Reviews.Content: This has to be the best deal on the market for a fully loaded 32" HDTV. With 1080p and 120Hz payload, all for $500 bucks delivered. After much research, we found you'll pay at least $250 more for comparable up market brands. Only found at Circuit City on-line + free shipping. The picture is outstanding, sound is more than acceptable, considering no 32" HDTV has great sound (I recommend an add-on of the stereo "Sound Bar" for around $120). As for construction, the Vizio is no different in quality than any other set on them market. One negative is the on set controls, which are virtually non-existent. You get an on-off push button that shuttles left and right.  The Panasonic, by comparison has a fully load instrument panel on the side. But then, you never need to deal with on-set controls, so it's a moot point.The remote control is slimmer than most and a bit uncomfortable in the hand. Not as solid as other remotes,but again, if you're hooked up to a cable box,the Vizio remote can be put in a drawer. You use the cable universal remote. The only glitch we found may have come from our cable installer, since after the cable box was set up, the Vizio remote stopped working entirely, which is not good in the event you need to bump up source volume, etc.All in all, Vizio is a remarkable "dark horse" brand, perhaps used more in corporate and commercial venues. With its home base in California, it's all good.Alan Leder

Reviews.Title: This is my first wide-screen TV purchase; so far so good!
Reviews.Author: J. Piper
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for about three weeks, after replacing a 27-year-old Zenith that was still in good working condition (if only all electronic appliances could be counted on to last so long!).  After doing some research, I knew I wanted a set with a 120 refresh rate.  I saw this one for a great price at BJ's, and I have been very happy with it.  The picture is chrystal clear, and the sound quality is quite good (not comparing it to any kind of fancy theatre system, obviously, but as far as I'm concerned, it's very adequate for my needs).  Some reviews have complained of the lighted "Vizio" logo in front, and I feared it would be distracting, but I haven't been bothered by it at all.  Too much going on on the screen for my peripheral vision to take notice of the lighted word beneath.  I hope this TV will last a long time, but just in case, I insured it with an inexpensive SquareTrade warranty, which is very economical compared with store or manufacturer warranties ([...]).  So, just adding my two cents to the other glowing reviews; I don't think you'll be disappointed if you purchase this product.

Reviews.Title: Best Computer Monitor Ever...ok not ever but almost
Reviews.Author: Warren Massey
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV almost a year ago and have had plenty of time to work with it. The purpose of the TV was to be my new computer monitor so the review will mostly focus on that. My requirments were 1080P for higher desktop resolution at 1920x1080, 120hz as it is occassionaly used for media, and overall sharpness/colors. This TV exceeded this in all categories. I previously purchased and still own a SV420XVT I purchased for the bedroom and was our first Vizio purchase.Vizio really impressed me with the cost and quality so I went with the SV320XVT after extensive research. First, on the TV it did everything I wanted. The desktop, as I type right now is crisp as the best Sony monitor. I have no refresh issues and the sound quality with virtual surround is eerily good. I say that because it is able to simulate rear right and left speakers even though I sit 2 feet from the TV. So, as a computer monitor I could reccomend this more and I really look at it as a very long term investment. This is due to the high feature set since this is a premium model from Vizio and the fact were not going to see the succesor to 1080P anytime soon.That covers the review, now Ill tell you about the pros and cons of using a TV as a computer monitor. Most of these I learned POST purchase, so please read this.Pros1. Very large screen, at 32 inches you will have no issues seeing the desktop icons, pictures, or text. If you have any vision problems, I highly reccomend looking into a 26+ inch 1080P TV as a monitor.2. Great for media playback, with 1080P and 120hz, the TV faithfully reproduces movies with astounding quality. I say this as a home theater specialist with a number of mid to high end TVs/Projectors.Cons1. Very large screen. So why did I repeate a pro? Because I believe I came close to making a big mistake, not with this TV but with its bigger brother, the SV370XVT. The reason is that 1080P or 1920x1080 is in fact a very large and respectable resolution but the larger the screen that the resolution is used on, the bigger everything looks. Icons are enlarged, text is bigger, etc. So in essence, as you increase in screen size but remain at the same resolution, you begin losing desktop real estate.So the reason I mentioned the SV370XVT is because I was so close to pulling the trigger but I felt it may be too big for 1080P and boy was I right. At 32 inches, I think 1080P hits a little above the sweet spot for computer monitors. A 27 or 30 inch is probably the sweet spot but you dont get that "Giant Screen in front of your Face" coolness. So think carefully on the size you want, again I reccomend the 32 overall.2. Sound, oh man, Sound. So, Sound is really good on the TV but I discovered that to use the sound for a PC with DVI through HDMI, many a hurdle is required. So, if you have an HDMI port on your PC, dont worry your are good to go :) but if your like me and have DVI, read further. So the issue is this, when you plug a monitor into a PC/Mac/Whatever, it identifies it by a unique identifier. The problem is that your PC will see this TV as exactly what it is, a TV and try to push sound through HDMI. Thats fine if you have an HDMI port but if your using a DVI-HDMI adapter, more then likley your video card doesnt support passing sound through DVI.So your PC will refuse to use any other sound ports like RCA for instance. Now, this isnt Vizios fault and it isnt Nvidia or ATI's fault. Without this feature, your PC or DVD player, etc just wouldnt know how to communicate with your TV. So with that said, here is how you fix this. Understand that it is technical but if you follow the instructions or grab your neigborhood geek, youll be fine. We need to trick the PC into thinking the TV is really just a plain old monitor. By doing that, it no longer will try to push audio through HDMI and will use your RCA cable instead.Here is a link: [...]So despite some of the cons and nearly a year on this TV, its still the best computer monitor I have every owned and if the 1080P successor is any later, it may well be the best one ever.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Bradley
Reviews.Content: This TV gives a fantastic picture and has more options than most TV's in this price range.  It looks beautiful mounted on the wall, the slim profile is great for this.  We just returned a Sony and bought a second Vizio, the 37" version to go along with the 32".  I highly recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Using as a PC Monitor for PC Gaming....WOW...great purchase
Reviews.Author: Cr0m
Reviews.Content: I decided to go with a flat screen TV for a PC monitor to play PC games.  As PC games offer far superior graphics and game play options than the PS3, Xbox or Wii...I wanted to enjoy them on a bigger screen without having to move my PC into my Home Theater.So I picked up this and am floored by how great this is working as a monitor.  I tried the HDMI connection and it was good, but then tried the RGB input and it was AMAZING.The graphic details in PC games just pop and with the larger screen and the high rez graphics, you can see details you would miss on a smaller monitor.I have not tried to actually watch TV on it though...so I cannot comment on the TV perfomance.If you are a PC gamer and want some big screen experience...try this TV.  Note, you should have a graphics card that can easily drive the 1080 resolution.

Reviews.Title: 2nd TV
Reviews.Author: R. S. Harter
Reviews.Content: 2nd Vizio tv, because we liked the first one. This one was just as good as the first one. Both are excellent.

Reviews.Title: Typing at the computer while watching TV on the PIP
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Perfect for a small apartment. My old TV was too big and too heavy.Maybe outmoded today because it doesn't have WIFI built in, but the TiVo box makes up for that.Dropped the remote and broke it. Found an all-in-one remote which does much of the same features.But I hate going through endless menus. Wish it would just remember my set up and always show that when I turn it on.Would be nice to slide the PIP in and out or across the screen, Some day maybe transparent PIP.

Reviews.Title: Satisfied
Reviews.Author: wagatag
Reviews.Content: I received this from Amazon about a month ago, and I am happy with the time it took to deliver, as well as the condition of the item after being shipped from so far away. Thanks Amazon, and UPS.I can say that I am happy about this purchase. However, do I think it is the perfect television, No. It is a little wobbly, but nothing that I'm concerned about. I would say my biggest complaint is: the red colors in the picture don't seem to be great. I've noticed that most of the reds seem the same shade without much variation, almost a cartoon color. Also, some times I noticed that when a camera is moving across a scene, it jitters. I would not have expected that from a 120 hz.Overall for the price I paid, $399, I think I got my moneys worth.

Reviews.Title: 2nd ones the charm
Reviews.Author: Eric Mcsweeney "emcs111"
Reviews.Content: 1st one arrived with a shattered screen. Exchange process was very easy & the 2nd one arrived in 4 business days. TV setup was very easy. You can't beat it for this price.

Reviews.Title: vizio tv
Reviews.Author: Catherine Borton
Reviews.Content: I could not be happier with this purchase. Not only is the overall quality of the set great but I saved $100 over Sam's Club price. I especially love that the sound is all in the front. I'm getting better sound from the back of 2 other HDTVs from 2 different manufacturers. From now on I'm only buying Vizio and have recommended it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Value
Reviews.Author: Tandy
Reviews.Content: The Vizio SV320XVT is my first hdtv.  I am very pleased with its picture quality.  Sometimes I feel like I am in the room with the stars on shows like CSI. It's very surreal!

Reviews.Title: Right Price and Picture
Reviews.Author: Jay Em
Reviews.Content: I am extremely pleased with my new TV. The picture is outstanding and it was so easy to set up and get going. With it's price and quality I would recommend a Vizio to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Only online!
Reviews.Author: Shortie
Reviews.Content: Exactly what we wanted. This size TV (32-inch) with 120Hz is impossible to find in stores. It took some searching, but we finally found it online and at a great price. Delivery was on time. Setup was easy, cable, DVD, VCR and Wii all hooked up without buying any extra cables. Very happy with purchase.

Reviews.Title: Garbage
Reviews.Author: Sean
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Vizio SV320XT in February 2011 and here it is August 2012 and the power won't come back on.  Now I have a $400 paper weight.  I used the tv in my bedroom during that entire time and I was happy with it.  All I did was try to move it to another room and when I plugged it in...nothing.  The VIZIO name would no longer light up, and I can no longer turn on my tv.  I contacted support and they ran me through the standard tests.  Unplugging, holding the power button for 30 seconds, plugging it back in, trying a different outlet, swapping power cords with another device.  In the end, they told me it needed repaired.  Not worth it!  Now I'm never going to purchase another Vizio product again and I recommend that anybody reading this does the same.

Reviews.Title: Best Bang For The Buck
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: The Vizio 32" has meet all my needs as as for picture quality and price, this television also has decent speaker's.  I know a lot of reviews gave this TV low ratings on the sound quality, if you can't hear these speakers clearly you probably should get your hearing checked.  I also use it as a computer monitor and it works great in that area as well.  I would recommend this product to a friend if one should need a 32" television.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Ferret
Reviews.Content: The TV came just as promised an on the correct day. I've had it about a month and haven't had any problems with it. Great buy!

Reviews.Title: Very Satisfied
Reviews.Author: L. Johnson
Reviews.Content: This HD TV had the features I wanted in a 32 in model--1080p and 120 Hz.  It arrived on time and was very easy to set up. Would buy it again.

Reviews.Title: Bought refurbished, Received a new tv!
Reviews.Author: Apav
Reviews.Content: Well, it actually is refurbished, but if I ask any of my mates they think I bought it brand new. I saved $200 from doing this and Buy-Dakota here is a great seller, get it from them for sure.I wasted $300 on a piece of crap Samsung hdtv, even with HDMI the quality looks terrible. So I decided to buy this. All I have to say is Oh.My.God.! I can't freaking believe how great this tv works, and it is so easy to setup! The great thing is it is the same screen size as my Samsung, but it's much smaller! I love the buttons. The remote is thin and very clicky, and the side control on the tv is like a dial, you turn it to select settings.120Hz is a feature I don't see in many 32 1080p's lately, and it definitely makes a difference in video games, sports, and fast paced movies. I've heard complaints that the sound isn't great, but I disagree. I couldn't be happier with the tv's sound. The only thing that may throw people off is the scale they use for the volume. You may have to set the volume to 20-35 to get it to a decent volume.The build quality is superb. This tv is very well built, and very study on its stand it comes with.Overall this tv has a much greater quality then I have ever seen in my search for a new tv, the 120Hz really separates it from its competitors, the sound is great, this tv is structures well, and I'm very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, great price
Reviews.Author: Patrick McNary "Bullwinkle"
Reviews.Content: I had seen this TV in the stores and done research on it.  I found it for the best price on Amazon.  Not only did it arrive before they promised it, but the shipping was free.  In Alaska, that can be a sizeable part of the cost. Several of my gamer friends agreed the video quality was very good for a unit of this type.  I'm very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: A great TV
Reviews.Author: tyronehuff "Tyler"
Reviews.Content: I received this TV around 8 months ago for Christmas, and have been 100% pleased every time I've used it since then. I wasn't able to hook it up for about a week after I got it because I was moving, and it was a very long week because I really wanted to see how well it would work. I wasn't disappointed when I finally was able to use it.Shortly after connecting the power cord and cable and powering it on, it prompts you to scan all the channels and it will tell you the amount of channels as well as how many of them are digital. This seemed like it took a while, but it's barely enough to make a mention in a review.After going through the settings, I was flipping channels and landed on the digital ABC channel showing the Rose Bowl between Oregon and Ohio State, and I was amazed at the picture. It was such an upgrade from a non HD 1080 TV, which is what I had before. A few weeks later I bought an HD XBOX 360, and again I was completely blown away. It really is a different experience, and I won't be able to go back to what I had before.The controller is a well made component, it feels like a good quality plastic with good weight. The buttons are well spaced, a good height and easy to press. The volume and channel buttons are unique and they work well  for their purpose.The sound is good; there's been no problem with the speakers and it sounds like a TV should. This TV wasn't bought for it's sound though, so the fact the sound isn't fantastic doesn't hurt my opinion of it. Overall this TV is a 5 star, a little overpriced I believe though. My dad was able to get this TV for about $350-400 during the holiday season; if you can get this at $400 or less then it's a 5+ star deal.

Reviews.Title: Great Company
Reviews.Author: Thomas A. Loyd "Tom"
Reviews.Content: Love this tv, got it at a great price, my brother has Sony Bravia XBR, the picture quality on Vizio XVT is just as good at a much better price

Reviews.Title: Very pleased.
Reviews.Author: R. Sweet "RS"
Reviews.Content: I've had jobs at several retail stores and somehow always ended up selling TV's in the electronics department so I knew what to look for. As a college student I was on a budget and needed a TV quick because my roommate had moved out and left me TV-less. I wanted something that wasn't going to be outdated in a year, was cheap, and looked nice. This TV fit the bill.Pro's:-Good picture quality. Compared to my roomies 42" Sony Bravia that was over twice the price of this TV the Vizio looked sharper and brighter.-1080p and 120Hz made Sports look so much better. While this isn't as good as a 600Hz plasma it is still pretty nice and way better than the run of the mill 60Hz.-Backlight LED makes gaming look very nice-Design is pretty sleek (although the base attracts dust like nothing I've ever seen)Con's:-Speakers are a little sharp/tinny. They're still very functional, but shrill. I would not listen to music through them.-Not as many inputs as I would have liked. Only having one standard stereo input means I have to swap out my Wii, N64, and SNES. I might actually have to spend my Fridays talking to people.-Sleek black remote gets grimey looking-I'm personally not a fan of the Smooth Motion feature that enhances low quality 60Hz footage to look "smoother". To me it makes everything except HD video look super fake like a cheesey Soap Opera. Look out Johnny, Claudette has amnesia. I was watching "The Birds" and this feature was unbearable. I leave it off all the time. Blu-rays are unaffected by this feature, obviously.Very pleased with this TV and would definitely purchase again.

Reviews.Title: Only lasts 1 year
Reviews.Author: Scout
Reviews.Content: It's a great tv, but you'll only have it for a little over a year.  I was very happy with my purchase until now. A horizontal black line appeared on the bottom screen on the tv, and 3 days later, the problem progressed to blurred vertical lines on over half of the tv's screen.  Called VIZIO, and since I am past the 1-year warranty, they can't do anything except give me the number of the HD repair guy.  Thanks, never buying VIZIO again.this was the model:[...]

Reviews.Title: Good TV
Reviews.Author: Mrs.Thunders
Reviews.Content: We bought this TV to hang on our bedroom wall.  The TV works well and the picture is great.  The only thing I do not like is that it automatically picks up both analog and digital channels.  The analog channels have no signal (screen is blue).  When I manually enter a channel using the remote, it automatically takes me to the analog channel, which has no signal.  This is very irritating and I have not figured out how to fix this issue.

Reviews.Title: Right TV for price
Reviews.Author: A. Elliott
Reviews.Content: Got this for my brother as a graduation present for him to take to college. He says the picture is first class and has nothing but good things to say about the size as it has a small footprint and does not take up much space. He said he made minor changes to the settings to get the picture where he wanted it, but this was easily done.  I liked the fact that we had 30 days to return it if there were any issues, but there were no dead pixels or shadows.  I will be looking at this TV again, the next time I need one this size.

Reviews.Title: everything but a video output
Reviews.Author: Wedge Fletch
Reviews.Content: I love the tv,,the specs tell you this is top shelf.I like how you can alter the top or side scanning to deal with cropped pictures on foreign letterboxed films.Why no video output though?

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: jcolvard
Reviews.Content: I am extremely pleased with the product.  However, I have one concern, how do I purchase a extended warranty

Reviews.Title: Great TV, good value
Reviews.Author: Marcus Howard
Reviews.Content: If my unit lives its MTBF, great value.Makes a fine first or second monitor.This purchase replaced a vacuum tube 34-inch HDTV weighing 148 pounds.I learned about this manfacturer while shopping Amazon.  Excellent on-line specifications and background.  I plan to look to Visio as a standard of features and value for future needs.This is a buy for 32 inch or $400.

Reviews.Title: Too many problems, quality not there
Reviews.Author: rania
Reviews.Content: Less than one year later, the picture just goes away. Need to bang on side of TV to get picture back. getting harder now even with banging on side. 1st and last time to get a VIZIO. Go with brand name. Now, I'll probably get an extended warranty too.Don't make my mistake by sacraficing quality to save $100.

Reviews.Title: WRONG ITEM!
Reviews.Author: Susanwhosan
Reviews.Content: I bought the television as it was advertised with 1080p but realized after I had it all hooked up, it only had 720p. It was packed in the 1080 box and even included the 1080 manual but was the wrong product. The best part was my conversation and the refund process with Amazon went smoothly and my refund was posted with 48 hours. There was not an actual 1080p available. This event did change my opinion of ordering "refurbished" equipment obviously. NOTE-I saw this very same product at a local Walmart for $20.00 cheaper and it was brand new....

Reviews.Title: Price?
Reviews.Author: Bargain Shopper
Reviews.Content: I am always nervous buying a big ticket item online without seeing it first in person. However, I cannot find this model in any of my local stores. I did, however, see a similiar vizio next to a samsung at my local electronics store and noticed significant hazing on the vizio when viewing from an angle as opposed to the samsung which stayed bright and clear. Even so, I was prepared to buy this vizio tv due to the great reviews and 399 price tag. Bummer that when I go to check out the next day on amazon it has increased in price by almost 200 bucks! That's crazy. So with the recent vizio price increase, I think I am better off going with a samsung. sorry amazon, sorry vizio...

Reviews.Title: Plasma Still Better
Reviews.Author: amsmith9 "amsmith9"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for a bedroom thinking it didn't need to be great.  It does have a great picture, but LCD still laggy for sports or fast moving images.  Another annoyance is the lighted Vizio logo just under the screen is very distracting and cannot be turned off.  I read some people put a piece of black tape over it, but thought I shouldn't have to do that on such an expensive product.  In the end, I couldn't take the strain on my eyes with the lagginess and returned it.  I moved my living room Panasonic plasma to the bedroom and replaced it with a new Panasonic 42" plasma.  Ahhh...so nice.  For the record, refresh rate on my plasma is 600 Hz, while this one and most LCD's are 120 Hz.  Way better for sports.
